messages.message: @Serena I don’t think I did, but we may have discussed this! We have had a ticket about the data output from our APIs always being in JSON so you don’t get a markdown table over API
is the output as markdown a choice we’ve made or is it just how the LLM’s output such prompts (i.e. “make table of …“)?

Outputting tables as markdown is a choice we’ve made, probably bc the backend team wanted the original frontend code to work

cc @Lalit

what we really need in the BE is the appropriate abstraction for each type (i.e. `Table`, `JSON`, etc.). that gives us the flexibility to choose output formatting and standardizes types across extraction, validation, and exporting steps

in considering the scenario where there is text mixed with a table, I’m wondering if a more complex “result” object type could be what we want. Something that is an array of objects that defines each section of a result:
```[
   { type: 'TEXT', display: "This is the table outputted", value: "This is the table outputted" },
   { type: 'TABLE', display: <markdown table>, value: <nested array> },
   { type: 'OBJ_LIST, display: <markdown table>, value: <nested array> },
]```
Then we can render this out item by item with formatting as is needed. This is just a first pass at the idea, but it would be a universal format that all UI’s could manage.
this gets us close to Rich Text Editor territory which is really not somewhere we should get involved with. So I’ll have to think about my idea a bit more.
Thanks for taking a look everyone! FR here: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1714?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiODYzMzg1NzExZDgzNDI5NjliMGEzZTQ1Njc2NzJjNWEiLCJwIjoiaiJ9
